original_title: Luxury aged care resort opens in Negombo
original_body_lines: A new chapter in elderly care has begun with the opening of Grand Leisure Care and Wellness Resort, the island’s first luxury wellness resort dedicated to seniors, post-recovery patients, and those seeking long-term comfort and holistic care. Located in the peaceful surroundings of Palagathure East, Kochchikade, Negombo, the newly opened resort is already drawing attention for its unique blend of high-quality hospitality, healthcare, and emotional well-being setting a new standard for senior living in Sri Lanka.

“We designed Grand Leisure as more than just a retirement home. It’s a sanctuary where senior citizens can live with dignity, independence, and joy supported by professional care and world-class facilities,” said a spokesperson for the resort.

“The resort offers a wide range of accommodation options to suit different needs and budgets from private large luxury suites (ideal for individuals or couples wanting to live independently or with family), to single rooms, double rooms, and shared accommodation for those preferring a more social or affordable option. All rooms are thoughtfully designed with senior safety and comfort in mind, featuring air conditioning, smart TVs, Wi-Fi, spacious ensuite bathrooms, and 24/7 emergency call systems. For those with greater care needs, the facility also provides dedicated nursing beds and round-the-clock medical support, ensuring complete peace of mind for residents and their families,” he said.

“Grand Leisure offers comprehensive full board packages that include meals, accommodation, wellness checks, and personal care with prices starting from just Rs. 95,000 per month (approximately USD 315). This makes high-quality aged care and luxury senior living more accessible than ever”, he said.
